response.raw:
Here is my attempt at the requested output:

Disseminating Information on BI Tools, Reports, and Metadata

1. Identify the key stakeholders and target audience for the information dissemination. This may include executives, managers, analysts, and end users of the BI tools and reports. 2. Determine the most effective communication channels to reach the target audience. This could include email newsletters, intranet posts, lunch-and-learn sessions, webinars, or in-person meetings. 3. Create clear and concise documentation highlighting the capabilities, benefits, and use cases of the BI tools, reports, and metadata enhancements. Use visuals like screenshots and diagrams to aid understanding. 4. Schedule and conduct training sessions to walk users through the new features and answer any questions they may have. Provide hands-on exercises to reinforce learning. 5. Set up a centralized repository or knowledge base where users can access documentation, FAQs, tutorial videos, and other resources related to the BI tools and metadata. 6. Establish a feedback mechanism and support channels for users to report issues, suggest improvements, or seek assistance when using the BI tools and reports. 7. Continuously gather user feedback and analytics to measure adoption, identify areas for improvement, and inform future enhancements to the BI tools, reports, and metadata.
response.extracted:
Disseminating Information on BI Tools, Reports, and Metadata

1. Identify the key stakeholders and target audience for the information dissemination. This may include executives, managers, analysts, and end users of the BI tools and reports. 2. Determine the most effective communication channels to reach the target audience. This could include email newsletters, intranet posts, lunch-and-learn sessions, webinars, or in-person meetings. 3. Create clear and concise documentation highlighting the capabilities, benefits, and use cases of the BI tools, reports, and metadata enhancements. Use visuals like screenshots and diagrams to aid understanding. 4. Schedule and conduct training sessions to walk users through the new features and answer any questions they may have. Provide hands-on exercises to reinforce learning. 5. Set up a centralized repository or knowledge base where users can access documentation, FAQs, tutorial videos, and other resources related to the BI tools and metadata. 6. Establish a feedback mechanism and support channels for users to report issues, suggest improvements, or seek assistance when using the BI tools and reports. 7. Continuously gather user feedback and analytics to measure adoption, identify areas for improvement, and inform future enhancements to the BI tools, reports, and metadata.
